title: Multivariate Analysis for the Classification of Chocolate According to its Percentage of Cocoa by Using Terahertz Time-Domain Spectroscopy (THz-TDS)
summary: This paper explores the use of terahertz time-domain spectroscopy (THz-TDS) for classifying chocolate according to its cocoa percentage. The authors employ multivariate analysis and machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines (SVM), to achieve a high accuracy rate of 93%. This study demonstrates the potential of THz-TDS in the food industry for non-destructive inspection and quality control.
methodology: The authors used terahertz time-domain spectroscopy (THz-TDS) to analyze the absorbance spectra of chocolate samples with different cocoa percentages. They employed multivariate analysis and machine learning algorithms, specifically support vector machines (SVM), to classify the samples.
research_outcomes: The study achieved a high accuracy rate of 93% in classifying chocolate according to its cocoa percentage using THz-TDS and SVM. The authors also demonstrated the potential of THz-TDS for non-destructive inspection and quality control in the food industry.

title: Crop Modeling with Less Data: The FAO Model for Soybean Yield Estimation
summary: This paper presents a low-input methodology for soybean yield estimation using the FAO-33 model and agroecological zone approach. The study combines indirect data with climate information from ECMWF to estimate yields, achieving reasonable accuracy.
methodology: The study uses a combination of the FAO-33 model and agroecological zone approach for soybean yield estimation. Agrometeorological data from ECMWF is used in conjunction with indirect data to estimate yields.
research_outcomes: The study achieves reasonable accuracy in estimating soybean yields using a low-input methodology.

title: Assessment of Flood Susceptibility Using Support Vector Machine in the Belt and Road Region
summary: This paper assesses flood susceptibility using a support vector machine (SVM) model in the Belt and Road region. The SVM model is used to generate a flood susceptibility map, and the results reveal that Southeast Asia is most susceptible to flooding. The study introduces the flood susceptibility comprehensive index (FSCI) to quantify the flood susceptibility levels of countries and sub-regions.
methodology: The SVM model was used to generate a flood susceptibility map based on 11 flood condition factors, including maximum three-day precipitation, altitude, standard deviation of elevation, slope, flow accumulation, topographic wetness index, river density, fractional vegetation cover, percentage of impervious surface, land cover, and soil texture.
statistics: The study uses statistical methods to analyze the relationship between flood susceptibility and various factors. The SVM model is used to generate a flood susceptibility map, and the results are evaluated using metrics such as accuracy and AUC values.
research_outcomes: The study reveals that Southeast Asia is most susceptible to flooding, and the FSCI is introduced to quantify the flood susceptibility levels of countries and sub-regions. The SVM model is shown to be effective in generating a flood susceptibility map.

title: Classification of Sidr honey and detection of sugar adulteration using right angle fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics
summary: This paper presents a method for classifying Sidr honey and detecting sugar adulteration using right angle fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics. The authors employed machine-assisted classification using the bagging algorithm, achieving high accuracy in discriminating between Sidr, sugar, and mixed Sidr-sugar samples.
methodology: The study used a combination of fluorescence spectroscopy and chemometrics to analyze honey samples. The authors employed principal component analysis (PCA) and the bagging algorithm for machine-assisted classification.
research_outcomes: The results showed high accuracy in discriminating between Sidr, sugar, and mixed Sidr-sugar samples. The method has potential applications in developing a quick, eco-friendly, and non-destructive analytical tool for honey researchers, producers, exporters, consumers, and retailers.

title: An extensive dataset for successful recognition of fresh and rotten fruits
summary: This paper presents a large-scale dataset for the classification of fresh and rotten fruits, which is crucial for agricultural productions and fruit processing industries. The dataset contains 16 types of fruit classes with 3200 original images and 12,335 augmented images, making it an essential resource for researchers to develop effective algorithms for recognizing more variety of fruits.
methodology: The authors used a deep learning approach, specifically convolutional neural networks (CNN), to classify fresh and rotten fruits. The dataset was preprocessed using augmentation techniques such as rotation, scaling, shearing, cropping, shifting, adjusting brightness, contrast, saturation, and hue.
statistics: Histogram Equalization is another approach that was used to improve image contrast.
research_outcomes: The authors demonstrated the effectiveness of their dataset in classifying fresh and rotten fruits with high accuracy. The results show that the proposed method can be used for real-life applications such as early detection and classification of fresh and rotten fruits.

title: Assessment of in Vitro Pollen Germination and Pollen Tube Growth of Annona Cherimola Mill
summary: This paper assesses the in vitro pollen germination and growth of nine ecotypes and one cultivar of Annona cherimola Mill. The study evaluates the percentage of pollen germination and length of pollen tubes after 2 and 24 hours of incubation, with no mention of machine learning or artificial intelligence methods used.
methodology: The study uses a completely randomized design with four replications to evaluate the variables studied. The pollen was obtained from the A. cherimola collection of the Austro Experimental Station and evaluated in vitro using an optical microscope.
research_outcomes: The study found that Fabulosa and Austro ecotypes had the highest pollen germination in the male phenological stage, after 2 and 24 hours in both seasons. The ideal phenological stage for pollen collection was at anther dehiscence.

title: Evaluation of Five Gas Diffusion Models Used in the Gradient Method for Estimating CO 2 Flux with Changing Soil Properties
summary: This paper evaluates the applicability of five commonly used gas diffusion models in estimating soil CO 2 flux using the gradient method. The study assesses the effects of changing soil properties on the accuracy of these models and compares their performance with a reference method.
methodology: The authors use Fick's first law to estimate soil CO 2 flux based on CO 2 concentration in the vertical soil profile and the CO 2 diffusion coefficient in the soil. They evaluate five gas diffusion models: Millington-Quirk, Penman, Marshall, Penman-Millington-Quirk, and Moldrup.
research_outcomes: The study finds that the Moldrup model yields the highest accuracy in estimating soil CO 2 flux, followed by the Millington-Quirk model. The other models perform poorly. The results also indicate that soil CO 2 flux is highly sensitive to the diffusion model used.

title: Violence Detection in Ranches Using Computer Vision and Convolution Neural Network
summary: This paper proposes a violence detection system using computer vision and convolutional neural networks to detect animal fights in ranches, reducing the need for close supervision and monitoring. The system uses machine learning models to identify fights and alert ranchers, with an accuracy of up to 93%.
methodology: The study proposes a method that detects and reports activities of violence to ranchers using computer vision and machine learning. Different machine learning models were built for each animal species.
research_outcomes: The proposed system can detect animal fights with high accuracy, reducing the need for close supervision and monitoring in ranches.

title: The Factors Influencing Market Price Of Sago Starch In Meranti Islands By Linear Regression
summary: This paper investigates the factors influencing market price of sago starch in Meranti Islands using linear regression. The study finds that the number of sago farmers, annual production, and area of sago land significantly impact the market price. Linear regression is used to analyze the relationship between variables, providing a graphical visualization of the distribution of data.
methodology: The paper uses linear regression as a machine learning method to analyze the effect of exogenous variables on endogenous variables.
research_outcomes: The study finds that the number of sago farmers, annual production, and area of sago land significantly impact the market price of sago starch. The results can be used as a reference for industry and trade offices in Meranti district to determine the market price.
sources_of_inspiration: Deforestation driven by urban population growth and agricultural trade in the twenty-first century

title: Image Processing Technology Based on Internet of Things in Intelligent Pig Breeding
summary: This paper explores the application of image processing technology based on the Internet of Things in intelligent pig breeding. The authors use image processing to monitor and manage pig growth environment, health, diet, and other aspects, significantly improving production efficiency and reducing labor costs.
methodology: The authors used a comparative reference method to establish an experimental group and a control group with 10 cubs in each group. The experimental group adopted intelligent breeding, while the control group used traditional breeding methods.
research_outcomes: The results showed that the weight gain of pigs in the experimental group was significantly faster than that of the control group, and the probability of infection was significantly lower than that of the control group.

title: Recent Advances in Novel Packaging Technologies for Shelf-Life Extension of Guava Fruits
summary: This review discusses the physiology, mechanism of ripening, oxidation, and ethylene production of guava fruits. It also reviews recent developments in packaging technologies such as modified atmosphere packaging (MAP), controlled atmosphere packaging (CAP), and edible films or coatings for extending shelf life.
methodology: The review discusses the physiology and mechanism of ripening, oxidation, and ethylene production of guava fruits. It also reviews recent developments in packaging technologies such as MAP, CAP, and edible films or coatings.
research_outcomes: The review highlights the importance of proper storage and packaging of guava fruits to extend shelf life. It also discusses the critical factors for higher perishability of guava, including early increase in respiration rate and biosynthesis of ethylene after harvest.

title: Effects of in ovo injection of microalgae on hatchability, antioxidant and immunity-related genes expression, and post-hatch performance in broilers and Japanese quails
summary: This paper investigates the effects of in ovo injection of microalgae on hatchability, antioxidant and immunity-related genes expression, and post-hatch performance in broilers and Japanese quails. The study found that in ovo injection of Spirulina platensis improved hatchability, antioxidant, and immunity-related gene expression in quail chicks.
methodology: The study used a controlled experiment design with two separate experiments. In the first experiment, fertilised eggs were divided into six groups: control, sham control, and four treatment groups with different concentrations of Spirulina platensis injected into the air sac of the fertile eggs.
statistics: Statistical methods used include analysis of variance (ANOVA) and real-time PCR to evaluate gene expression.
research_outcomes: The study found that in ovo injection of Spirulina platensis improved hatchability, antioxidant, and immunity-related gene expression in quail chicks. The results also showed that the treatment groups had lower feed conversion ratio (FCR) compared to the control group.

title: Deep Learning Techniques for In-Crop Weed Identification: A Review
summary: This paper reviews recent developments of deep learning techniques in image-based weed detection, highlighting the potential for accurate and efficient weed control. The review discusses various deep learning architectures, including convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and graph neural networks (GNNs), and their applications in weed identification.
methodology: The paper reviews recent developments of deep learning techniques in image-based weed detection, discussing various architectures and their applications.
research_outcomes: The review highlights the potential for accurate and efficient weed control using deep learning techniques.

title: Classification Modeling Method for Near-Infrared Spectroscopy of Tobacco Based on Multimodal Convolution Neural Networks
summary: This paper presents a method for identifying the origin of tobacco using near-infrared spectroscopy and multimodal convolutional neural networks. The proposed approach improves the accuracy of tobacco origin classification by leveraging the strong feature extraction ability of CNNs.
methodology: The methodology involves extracting features from one-dimensional near-infrared spectrum data using a one-dimensional convolutional neural network (1-D CNN), and then combining these features with structure features extracted from two-dimensional spectral images by the two-dimensional convolutional neural network (2-D CNN) method.
research_outcomes: The proposed approach achieves classification accuracy of 93.15% and 93.05% for 1-D CNN and 2-D CNN models, respectively, outperforming traditional PLS-DA methods.

title: Using Artificial Neural Networks and Remotely Sensed Data to Evaluate the Relative Importance of Variables for Prediction of Within-Field Corn and Soybean Yields
summary: This paper uses artificial neural networks (ANN) to predict within-field corn and soybean yields, leveraging remotely sensed data from satellite images. The study evaluates the relative importance of various predictor variables and identifies the most significant ones for each crop type.
methodology: The authors used a combination of ANN and remote sensing techniques to develop models that predict corn and soybean yields at the within-field level. They employed a range of spectral indices derived from satellite images, including NDVI, NDVIre, and Simple Ratio.
statistics: The study reports on the performance of the ANN models using metrics such as mean absolute error (MAE) and relative MAE.
research_outcomes: The results show that the ANN models can accurately predict corn and soybean yields at the within-field level, with the SR index and slope being identified as the most important predictor variables for both crop types.

title: Hyperspectral Spectroscopic Study of Soil Properties- A Review
summary: This paper reviews the use of hyperspectral spectroscopy for estimating soil properties, highlighting its potential as an alternative to traditional laboratory methods. However, machine learning or AI techniques are not used in this review.
methodology: The methodology involves reviewing existing literature on hyperspectral spectroscopy and its applications in soil analysis.
research_outcomes: The paper highlights the potential of hyperspectral spectroscopy for estimating soil properties, but does not present any new research outcomes or findings.

title: Faba Bean: An Untapped Source of Quality Plant Proteins and Bioactives
summary: This paper provides a comprehensive review of the nutritional and biofunctional qualities of faba beans, with a particular focus on protein-derived bioactive peptides. The study highlights the potential of faba beans as a sustainable and quality dietary protein source due to their high protein content, well-balanced amino acid profile, and presence of health-enhancing bioactive compounds.
methodology: The paper employs a comprehensive review approach, summarizing the latest key findings related to the nutritional qualities of faba beans and their biofunctional properties.
research_outcomes: The study highlights the potential of faba beans as a sustainable and quality dietary protein source due to their high protein content, well-balanced amino acid profile, and presence of health-enhancing bioactive compounds.

title: Prediction of active ingredients in Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge. based on soil elements and artificial neural network
summary: This paper uses an artificial neural network to predict the active ingredients in Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge. based on soil elements, expanding the application of artificial neural network methods in medicinal botany and providing references for its application in other directions.
methodology: The study used a BP neural network model to analyze the relationship between soil elements and active components of medicinal plants, establishing a prediction model based on input values from soil elements.
research_outcomes: The results showed that the artificial neural network model had the best performance (MSE = 0.0203, 0.0164; R2 = 0.93, 0.94) and could be used to screen suitable cultivation sites and optimize fertilizer application.

title: Storage stability of freeze-dried Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture as affected by various formulations of drying medium, and its fermentation characteristics in mung bean (Vigna radiata L.) slurry
summary: This paper investigates the storage stability of freeze-dried Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture using various formulations of drying medium, including mung bean powder with sucrose and trehalose. The study aims to evaluate the influence of these protective agents on the survival of L. plantarum S20 during freeze-drying and subsequent storage. The results show that supplementing mung bean powder with either sucrose or trehalose improves the survival of freeze-dried L. plantarum S20, but no significant difference was observed between the two disaccharides.
methodology: The study used a freeze-drying method to preserve Lactobacillus plantarum S20 starter culture. The drying medium formulations were prepared by mixing mung bean powder with sucrose and trehalose, and the viability of L. plantarum S20 was evaluated after freeze-drying and subsequent storage at 6±2°C and 30±1°C.
research_outcomes: The study found that supplementing mung bean powder with either sucrose or trehalose improves the survival of freeze-dried L. plantarum S20, but no significant difference was observed between the two disaccharides.

title: Imaging of plant current pathways for non-invasive root Phenotyping using a newly developed electrical current source density approach
summary: This paper presents a new method for non-invasive root phenotyping using an electrical current source density approach. The method, called inversion of Current Source Density (iCSD), images the positions where the current passes from the plant to the soil by measuring the distribution of the electric potential. The authors develop and test an iCSD inversion code that does not rely on prior assumptions on root architecture and function, and design and conduct rhizotron experiments to validate the approach.
methodology: The authors use a numerical inversion procedure to invert the acquired data from laboratory rhizotron experiments. The method is based on the distribution of electric current in the root-soil system.
research_outcomes: The study shows that the iCSD approach can image the positions where the current passes from the plant to the soil, providing direct insight into the root electrical behavior. The authors also evaluate the application of the iCSD method on different plant species (maize and cotton) and growing medium (soil and nutrient solution).

title: A Surrogate Modeling Approach for the Development of Biorefineries
summary: This paper introduces a generic approach to develop surrogate models for biorefining processes by integrating first-principle knowledge. The proposed methodology is applied to a real-life lignocellulosic organosolv technology, and three case studies demonstrate its potential.
methodology: The systematic framework involves an iterative procedure that gradually increases the complexity of the system used for the development of the surrogate model.
research_outcomes: The proposed methodology is able to develop accurate surrogate models for biorefining processes, which can be used for optimization and design purposes.

title: Strategic Priorities of the Scientific Plan of the European Research Infrastructure METROFOOD-RI for Promoting Metrology in Food and Nutrition
summary: This paper discusses the strategic priorities of the METROFOOD-RI, a pan-European research infrastructure for promoting metrology in food and nutrition. The paper outlines the key thematic areas of research in the food and nutrition domain, including sustainability, traceability, and FAIR data management practices.
methodology: The methodology involves identifying strengths and weaknesses of the RI in relation to emerging topics of scientific research in food and nutrition, and aligning them with wider societal goals and challenges.
research_outcomes: The paper identifies key thematic areas for research in the food and nutrition domain, including sustainability, traceability, and FAIR data management practices.

title: Optimization of cardamom fruit extraction using the Box–Behnken design
summary: This paper focuses on optimizing cardamom fruit extraction using the Box-Behnken design to recover polyphenolic compounds. The study aims to identify optimal conditions for solvent ratio, ethanol concentration, and extraction time to yield total phenolic content, total flavonoids, and antioxidant activity.
methodology: The Box-Behnken Design is used as an extraction optimization method based on the response surface method. The study involves maceration using 2 g of dried cardamom fruit powder with variables shown in Tables 1 and 2.
statistics: Statistical methods such as Folin-Ciocalteu, aluminum chloride, glacial acetic acid, proanalytical ethanol, and microplate reader are used to analyze total phenolic content, total flavonoid content, and antioxidant activity.
research_outcomes: The study identifies optimal conditions for solvent ratio, ethanol concentration, and extraction time to yield total phenolic content, total flavonoids, and antioxidant activity. The results can provide knowledge and information about the commercial use of cardamom as an alternative plant in pharmacology.

title: Spatiotemporal assessment and trade-offs of multiple ecosystem services based on land use changes in Zengcheng, China
summary: This paper assesses the spatiotemporal effects of urbanization on multiple ecosystem services in Zengcheng, China. The study uses land use classification and raster maps to detect past changes in land use types, and evaluates the trade-offs among different ecosystem services.
methodology: The authors used a combination of land use classification and raster maps to assess the spatiotemporal effects of urbanization on multiple ecosystem services. They classified land use types into seven categories according to the national standard for classification of land use.
research_outcomes: The study found that urbanization has negatively affected ecosystem services in Zengcheng, China. The authors recommend implementing sustainable land use planning policies and ecological engineering measures to improve ecosystem services.

title: Authentication of Peaberry and Civet Coffee Using UV-Visible Spectroscopy and PLS-DA Method
summary: This paper investigates the influence of particle size on the authentication of peaberry and civet coffee using UV-visible spectroscopy combined with partial least squares-discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) method. The study finds that particle size significantly affects the performance of PLS-DA model, but a calibration model can be developed to compensate for this influence.
methodology: UV-visible spectroscopy and PLS-DA method
research_outcomes: The study shows that particle size affects the performance of PLS-DA model, but a calibration model can be developed to compensate for this influence.
